title: Israeli, Saudi Stocks Fall as Middle East Conflict Worsens
content: Israeli stocks dropped on their first day of trading after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government began airstrikes against Iran. Saudi Arabia’s equity benchmark slid as concerns of a wider conflict gripped the region.

title: New World Sells 138 Hong Kong Homes at Discount Within Hours
content: New World Development Co. and its partners sold 138 apartments in a few hours at a new project after pricing the homes at a discount to lure buyers in Hong Kong’s sluggish real estate market.

title: China’s Biotech Moment Ignites a 60% Stock Rally That Beats AI
content: China’s biotechnology stocks have shaken off a four-year slump to be among the hottest performers in Asia this year and funds are tipping further gains.

title: Global Rate Limbo Reigns After 150 Days of Trump
content: Multiple central banks are set to keep interest rates frozen in the coming week while continuing to gauge the impact of trade disruptions instigated by US President Donald Trump.

title: Gundlach Is Latest to Sound Corporate Debt Alarms: Credit Weekly
content: DoubleLine Capital has its lowest-ever allocations to speculative-grade bonds now, because valuations just don’t reflect the risks.

title: Ecuador Expected to Delay Fee on Mining, Industry Says
content: Ecuador has indicated that it will consider delaying the implementation of a new mining fee estimated to generate $229 million annually, according to Rodrigo Darquea, vice president of the country’s mining chamber.

title: Tim Walz Speaks on Minnesota Democrats Assassination
content: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz held a press conference on the assassination of two democratic Minnesota state lawmakers and their spouses who were shot Saturday. Walz said it was likely a targeted political attack by a suspect impersonating a police officer. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nigeria’s Central Bank Halts Dividends, Bonuses for Some Banks
content: The Central Bank of Nigeria has ordered banks under regulatory forbearance to halt dividend payments, director bonuses, and foreign investments.

title: Russia, China to Lead Construction of Two Kazakh Nuclear Plants
content: Kazakhstan has selected Russia’s Rosatom to lead a consortium for the construction of its first nuclear power plant. The China National Nuclear Corp. expected to be lead a group to build a second atomic facility.

title: Retailers Seen Using Stablecoins to Push Back Against Card Fees
content: Stablecoins have become one of the hottest buzzwords in the world of finance as of late with US lawmakers on the cusp of passing the first guidelines for mainstream use of the cryptocurrencies designed to mirror the dollar.

title: Johnson & Johnson CEO: 'We’re in the Golden Era of Medical Innovation'
content: Johnson & Johnson Chairman and CEO Joaquin Duato believes that we are now in a “golden era” of innovation, particularly in the United States. Venture capital plays a vital early-stage role, but big pharma provides the infrastructure and market access. We visit Johnson & Johnson's innovation facility in Spring House to see how its early-stage innovation ecosystem serves patients and the local economy. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Golden Era’ of Medication Meets Geopolitical Uncertainty
content: In this episode of Wall Street Week, we talk to a longtime diplomat and the CEO of Johnson & Johnson

title: Fear of Uncertainty Held S&P 500 Back From Record. Now It’s Real
content: For weeks, the S&P 500 Index has inched along near an all-time high despite encouraging economic signals, as Wall Street’s concerns about a rich stock market in the face of mounting global uncertainty kept buying in check.

title: Nigeria’s United Capital Expands Into Francophone West Africa
content: United Capital Plc launched an investment management business from Côte d’Ivoire to operate in eight countries across French-speaking West Africa, according to a statement to the Nigerian stock exchange.

title: Banking’s Mediterranean Deal Flurry Widens With Novo Banco Sale
content: The wave of bank acquisitions washing over Southern Europe has reached Portugal.

title: The Big Gulf AI Deal That's Divided the White House
content: What does AI dominance actually mean?

title: The Big Gulf AI Deal Dividing The White House (Podcast)
HSBC Hastens Search to Find Next Chairman as Tucker’s Exit Nears
content: With the clock ticking in the hunt for HSBC Holdings Plc’s next chairman, Europe’s largest bank is speeding its efforts to assemble a list of candidates for the role.

title: ECB Within Reach of 2% Inflation Goal, Lagarde Tells Xinhua
content: The European Central Bank is approaching its goal for consumer-price growth, President Christine Lagarde said, warning of uncertainty emanating from US tariffs.

title: Influencer Marketing Gains Ground as Global Ad Budgets Tighten
content: Ashton Hall’s morning routine involves dunking his head in iced Saratoga Spring Water. For the company that sells the bottled water — Hall’s brand of choice for drinking, brushing his teeth and submerging himself — that’s fantastic news.

title: Switzerland’s Likely Rate Cut to Zero Threatens to Test Banks
content: The Swiss National Bank’s next cut in borrowing costs may be about to cause a headache for banks, if officials end up experimenting with their first-ever interest rate of zero.

title: Middle East Escalation, Lower Gas Prices, Johnson & Johnson, Flying Cars | Wall Street Week
content: This week, Richard Haass of Centerview Partners tells us what the escalation of geopolitical tension between Israel and Iran could mean for oil prices. And President Trump’s call for $2 gas may please consumers, but in oil towns like Odessa, falling prices threaten jobs, investment and the economic foundation of the US energy heartland. Plus, an interview with Johnson & Johnson’s CEO on the golden age of medical innovation. Later, will flying cars soon be a reality? (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Qualitas Health Weighs $942 Million Malaysian IPO, The Edge Says
content: Asian healthcare provider Qualitas Health Group is weighing an initial public offering that will raise as much as 4 billion ringgit ($942 million), according to a report in The Edge, citing sources with knowledge of the matter.

title: Middle East Tensions Escalate, Oil Prices Jump
content: Centerview Partners Senior Counselor Richard Haass says that while geopolitical tensions cause fluctuations in prices, there would have to be ongoing conflict to see a sustained upward move in oil prices. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stocks Sink, Oil Jumps as Mideast Tensions Build | The Close 6/13/2025
content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are John Bolton, Former US Ambassador, Rebecca Babin, CIBC Private Wealth Group, Stephen Trent, Citi, Bill Curtin, Hogan Lovells, Jess Menton, Bloomberg News, Jason Pride, Glenmede, Christopher Cain, Bloomberg Intelligence, Callie Cox, Ritzholtz Wealth Mgmt, Joe Cirincione, Center for International Policy, Andrew Kline, Park Lane, James Jeffrey, Former US Ambassador to Iraq & Turkey, Wendy Benjaminson, Bloomberg News. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Crystal Palace FC Backer Eagle Files Confidentially for US IPO
content: Eagle Football Holdings Ltd., one of the most active investors in football clubs globally, has filed confidentially for a US initial public offering.

title: Fmr US Amb to Iraq on Cconflict Between Israel-Iran
content: James Jeffrey, Former US Ambassador to Iraq & Turkey speaks with Romaine Bostick about the current conflict between Israel and Iran. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Sports Teams Now Run Like Tech Startups: Fmr. NFL Player
content: Andrew Kline, Park Lane Founder & Former St. Louis Rams Lineman speaks with Romaine Bostick about the rising valuations of sport teams. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: 23andMe Co-Founder Wins Auction for Genetic Data
content: The co-founder of bankrupt genetic analysis company 23andMe won an auction for the firm’s assets, agreeing, along with a California research institute, to pay $305 million for a cache of customer DNA data

title: JPMorgan Readies $6.5 Billion Skechers Debt Sale for Next Week
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. plans to kick off a $6.5 billion debt offering to support private equity firm 3G Capital’s purchase of footwear maker Skechers as soon as next week, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: China-US Deal Didn’t Address Some Rare Earths Controls: Reuters
content: The trade agreement reached by US and China in London left export restrictions tied to national security unresolved, Reuters reported, citing two people familiar with the matter.

title: ‘No Kings’ Rallies Draw Massive Crowds in US as Clashes Hit LA
content: Protesters filled streets in hundreds of cities across the US to oppose President Donald Trump’s administration on Saturday, as he held a military parade in Washington.

title: Israel, Iran Trade Blows for Third Day With No Sign of Letup
content: Israel and Iran continued intense bombardments on one another’s territories for the third day, with no sign of a reprieve and growing concerns over a wider conflict in one of the world’s key oil-producing regions.

title: Australia Prime Minister Albanese to Meet Trump at G-7
content: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said he is scheduled to meet US President Donald Trump on Tuesday during the G-7 summit in Canada.

title: Trump Parade Displays Military Power Amid National Protests
content: President Donald Trump’s military parade kicked off in Washington with a 21-gun salute, tanks and troops, as well as helicopters and parachutists, as protesters in hundreds of US cities demonstrated against his use of executive power.

title: Guinea Junta Sets Up Election Body For Upcoming Votes
content: Guinea’s military junta leader, General Mamadi Doumbouya, has created an institution that will be responsible for managing the constitutional referendum as well as upcoming political elections.

title: Manhunt Is On for Suspected Killer of Democrats in Minnesota
content: A manhunt was under way Saturday for a suspect who shot two Democratic Minnesota lawmakers and their spouses and carried a manifesto listing other politicians and abortion providers in the state.

title: Violeta Chamorro, Nicaragua’s Former President, Dies at 95
content: Violeta Barrios de Chamorro, the Nicaraguan leader whose rule in the 1990s marked the end of the country’s civil war and who served as Latin America’s first elected female president, died on Saturday at 95.

title: Starmer Indicates Prospect of Fresh UK-Canada Trade Talks
content: The UK will seek to restart trade negotiations with Canada, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on his way to meet his counterpart, Mark Carney as he strives to strengthen commercial ties around the world to better insulate Britain’s economy from the fallout of US President Donald Trump’s tariff war.

title: At Least 100 People Killed by Gunmen in Nigeria, Rights Group Says
content: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) — At least 100 people have been killed in a gun attack on a village in Nigeria ’s north-central Benue state, Amnesty International Nigeria said Saturday.

title: Trump, Putin Discuss Middle East Tensions in Hour-Long Call
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump discussed the escalating crisis between Israel and Iran in a roughly hour-long phone call on Saturday.

title: Iran Conflict Ensnares Energy as Israel Hits Giant Gas Field
content: The unfolding Middle East crisis extended to Iran’s energy infrastructure as Israel launched an attack on a giant gas field in the Persian Gulf, threatening further turmoil for markets.

title: Trump Earned $57.7 Million From Crypto Venture, Disclosure Shows
content: President Donald Trump earned $57.7 million from token sales by the crypto firm he and his sons helped launch last year, according to his required federal financial disclosure forms.

title: Critical Damage Dealt to Key Iranian Nuclear Site, IAEA Says
content: Israeli airstrikes dealt critical damage to a key Iranian nuclear facility, according to the United Nations atomic watchdog, likely setting back the Islamic Republic’s uranium fuel cycle by months.

title: Iran Fires Hundreds of Missiles at Israel as Conflict Escalates
content: Israel extended attacks against Iran as fighting escalated between the two sides, raising international concerns of a protracted conflict that threatens to engulf the oil-rich Middle East.

title: UK Will Launch Inquiry into Grooming Gangs, Starmer Says
content: The UK will launch a national inquiry into child grooming gangs, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said, in an about-turn that comes five months after rebuffing calls from the opposition Conservative Party and the billionaire Elon Musk to conduct a full probe.

title: NASA Considers Axiom Launch Next Week Following Delay
content: NASA is considering a Thursday launch date for the fourth Axiom astronaut mission to the International Space Station after a repair review caused a delay.

title: US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel Poised to Close After Trump Deal
content: Nippon Steel Corp. won conditional US approval for its $14.1 billion purchase of United States Steel Corp., capping a lengthy saga in a tie-up that will create one of the world’s largest steel companies.

title: UK Sends Jets to Protect Its Military Bases Over Iran Threat
content: The UK is moving aircraft to the Middle East to protect its military bases, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said, as he urged Israel and Iran to de-escalate their conflict.

title: Iran-US Talks on Sunday Called Off After Israeli Strikes
content: Nuclear talks between Iran and the US scheduled for Sunday in Oman will no longer take place, after Israeli attacks on the Islamic Republic prompted retaliatory strikes that escalated regional tensions.

title: US Opposes European Push to Lower G-7’s Russia Oil Price Cap
content: The US isn’t budging from its opposition to a lower price cap on Russian oil sales, people familiar with the matter said, dampening European hopes that leaders meeting for a Group of Seven summit in Canada will agree to a cut.

title: Egypt Postpones Opening of Flagship Museum Amid Regional Tension
content: Egypt postponed the long-anticipated inauguration of its flagship antiquities museum amid the ongoing military confrontation between Israel and Iran.

title: Thiam’s Party Holds Protest After Exclusion From Ivorian Vote
content: Ivory Coast’s main opposition party took to the streets Saturday after its candidate, former Credit Suisse AG Chief Executive Officer Tidjane Thiam, was barred from contesting in this year’s presidential elections.

title: Russia, China to Lead Construction of Two Kazakh Nuclear Plants
content: Kazakhstan has selected Russia’s Rosatom to lead a consortium for the construction of its first nuclear power plant. The China National Nuclear Corp. expected to be lead a group to build a second atomic facility.

title: Portugal Aims to Meet Defense Spending Goal of 2% of GDP in 2025
content: Portugal said it aims to reach a target for investment in defense to represent 2% of gross domestic product in 2025, reaffirming a plan to accelerate spending in the sector.

title: Iran’s Araghchi Says US Talks ‘Unjustified’ After Israeli Attack
content: Iranian foreign minister and lead negotiator, Abbas Araghchi, said continuing nuclear talks with the US would be “unjustifiable” in light of Israel’s ongoing military assault on the Islamic Republic, according to a government statement.

title: Zelenskiy Says US ‘Decisiveness’ Key to Pressuring Putin
content: Ukraine needs clarity from the US about steps to put pressure on Russia toward a ceasefire, since European support hinges on it, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said ahead of the G7 meeting in Canada, where he hopes to meet President Donald Trump.

title: Iran’s Nuclear Sites Hobbled But Not Destroyed, Experts Say
content: Israel’s airstrikes damaged Iran’s nuclear program but likely fell well short of eliminating it, experts said, presenting Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the US with a quandary on what to do next.

title: India Prime Minister Modi to Participate in G-7 Summit in Canada
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the G-7 Summit in Kananaskis, Canada, on June 16–17, marking his sixth consecutive appearance, the South Asian nation’s foreign ministry said in a statement.

title: Lavazza Studying Combination With Dallmayr, Corriere Says
content: Luigi Lavazza SpA is studying a tie-up with Germany’s Dallmayr as the coffee industry remains under pressure due to surging prices, Corriere della Sera reported on Saturday, without saying where it obtained the information.

title: BT CEO Says AI Advances Could Deepen Job Cuts: FT
content: BT Group Plc CEO Allison Kirkby says that advancements in artificial intelligence could deepen the job cuts that are already happening at the telecommunications firm in an interview with the Financial Times.

title: China’s Biotech Moment Ignites a 60% Stock Rally That Beats AI
content: China’s biotechnology stocks have shaken off a four-year slump to be among the hottest performers in Asia this year and funds are tipping further gains.

title: Amazon Plans $13 Billion Investment in Australia Data Centers
content: Amazon.com Inc. plans to invest A$20 billion ($13 billion) in Australia between this year and 2029 to develop its data-center infrastructure.

title: NASA Considers Axiom Launch Next Week Following Delay
content: NASA is considering a Thursday launch date for the fourth Axiom astronaut mission to the International Space Station after a repair review caused a delay.

title: Taiwan Imposes Technology Export Controls on Huawei, SMIC
content: Taiwan has blacklisted Huawei Technologies Co. and Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp., dealing another major blow to the two companies spearheading China’s efforts to develop cutting-edge AI chip technologies.

title: Ramp Hits $16 Billion Valuation in New Funding Round
content: Financial technology startup Ramp is now valued at $16 billion following a $200 million funding round, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Relativity Space Said to Reverse Stock Split After Schmidt Deal
content: Relativity Space Inc., a maker of 3D-printed rockets, enacted a reverse stock split that has significantly diluted existing shareholders and staff, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Neuralink Device Helps Monkey See Something That’s Not There
content: Elon Musk’s Neuralink Corp. used a brain implant to enable a monkey to see something that wasn’t physically there, according to an engineer, as it moves toward its goal of helping blind people see.

title: Meta's $14.3B Scale Investment, Apple's New Siri Launch | Bloomberg Tech 6/13/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde breaks down Meta’s plans to take a 49% stake in Scale AI and hire the startup's CEO, Alexandr Wang. Plus, the CEO of stablecoin network Circle discusses how the passing of the GENIUS Act could impact the payments space. And Apple targets the spring of 2026 for the launch of its revamped voice assistant Siri, as the iPhone maker plays catch-up in the AI race. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Adobe Slips After Revenue Outlook Fails to Sway AI Skeptics
content: Adobe Inc. shares fell the most in three months after the creative-software company gave a sales outlook for the current quarter that failed to calm investors who have been skeptical it can hold its own against AI-focused upstarts.

title: Drone Maker Airo Jumps 140% in Latest Post-IPO Debut Pop
content: Airo Group Holdings Inc. shares climbed 140% in their public trading debut on Friday after the company raised $60 million in an initial public offering, becoming the third company this month to more than double during its opening session.

title: Google’s Plan to Buy Security Firm Wiz Gets Antitrust Review
content: Justice Department antitrust enforcers are reviewing whether Google’s planned $32 billion acquisition of cybersecurity company Wiz Inc. would illegally limit competition in the marketplace, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Scale AI Backer Accel Set for $2.5 Billion Windfall on Meta Deal
content: Accel is among a handful of VC firms poised to see big returns from early bets on Scale AI.

title: A $60 Billion Visa, Mastercard Slump Seen as Buying Opportunity
content: A report that large multinational merchants are exploring ways to bypass traditional credit-card fees presents investors with an opportunity to buy shares of Mastercard Inc. and Visa Inc., according to Wall Street analysts.

title: Trump Seeks to Register His Name for Mobile Phone Service
content: DTTM Operations LLC, the entity that manages trademarks on behalf of President Donald Trump, has applied to use his name and the term T1 for telecom services.

title: Centerview Is Sole Bank on Meta’s $14 Billion AI Bet
content: One of the largest-ever investments in a private US company has minted just one investment banking winner: Centerview Partners.

title: Indie Music’s Growing Backlash Against the State of Streaming
content: As the streaming model evolves, tensions are building throughout the music industry

title: How ‘Hitman’ Developer Became One of the Largest Independent Game Companies
content: Eight years ago, IO Interactive was bleeding money. Now it’s one of the biggest privately owned video-game companies in the world.

title: Ransomware Plague Targeting Hospitals Comes to Ohio
content: Demonstrators drive trucks down interstate 70 as part of a Peoples Convoy 'Freedom and Accountability' caravan in Dayton, Ohio, U.S., on Thursday, March 3, 2022. The People's Convoy have called on President Joe Biden to end vaccine and other pandemic mandates while modeling themselves after Canadian drivers who had occupied the center of Ottawa in a similar protest.

title: CATL Shares Clouded by Bleak Outlook After Mega Hong Kong Debut
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. has received little love following its splashy $5.2 billion listing in Hong Kong last month, as investors eye multifold challenges in the global EV battery market.

title: Ships’ Electronics Increasingly Jammed Since Israel Struck Iran
content: Israel’s airstrikes on Iran have led to increased jamming of the signals of vessels operating in the Middle East, the world’s largest oil producing region, a multinational naval force protecting maritime trade said.

title: Micron Plans $200 Billion US Chip Spend, Chime IPO | Bloomberg Tech 6/12/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Micron’s plans to spend $200 billion on U.S. chip manufacturing and R&D. Plus, Chime CEO Chris Britt discusses the company’s growth strategy as the company goes public. And Oracle’s earnings impress investors with its rising cloud sales. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: OpenAI to Continue Working With Scale After Meta Deal, CFO Says
content: OpenAI said it will continue working with Scale AI after Meta Platforms Inc. made a multibillion-dollar investment in the startup, as it seeks to maintain a broad ecosystem of data sources.

title: How the Clippers Engineered the NBA’s Best Home Court Advantage
content: Reward the loudest fans and make sure there are lots and lots of bathrooms.

title: China Boosts Tesla Self-Driving Plan With Car-Data Export Rules
content: Chinese authorities released draft guidelines on transmitting data from automobiles overseas, a move that could pave the way for the wider rollout of Tesla Inc.’s most advanced driver-assistance functions in the world’s largest car market.

title: Abu Dhabi’s G42 Opens Europe Hub in Sign of Growing AI Ambition
content: Abu Dhabi’s main artificial intelligence company, G42, is launching a European unit as part of the emirate’s broader push into the continent, where the government has pledged billions of dollars in investment.

title: Meta Risks Regulatory Scrutiny in Pursuit of Scale AI
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Jackie Davalos reports on Big Tech’s “acqui-hire” strategy for artificial intelligence that is drawing scrutiny from regulators.

title: Big Tech Is Dealing Flat Design a Death Blow
content: From Airbnb’s new app icons to Apple’s “Liquid Glass” design, skeuomorphism is back and everything in the digital world has dimensionality again.

title: Taiyo to Decide on Delisting as Early as August, President Says
content: Taiyo Holdings Co. will decide on proposals from several private equity funds to delist it after a shareholder meeting this month, where its president is likely to face a vote on his ouster.

title: Global Rate Limbo Reigns After 150 Days of Trump
content: Multiple central banks are set to keep interest rates frozen in the coming week while continuing to gauge the impact of trade disruptions instigated by US President Donald Trump.

title: Dollar Ructions Lay Groundwork for a ‘Global Euro Moment’
content: When the euro was born more than a quarter century ago, it arrived with much fanfare. Even the US Federal Reserve chair of the time, Alan Greenspan, was excited. “To the extent the euro becomes a far more formidable force in the world economy, it’s a benefit to everybody, especially the US,” he said in January 2000.

title: Charting the Global Economy: Israeli Airstrikes Boost Oil Prices
content: Crude oil prices surged and investors sought the safety of gold after Israel conducted airstrikes on Iranian atomic facilities involved in nuclear enrichment.

title: ECB Within Reach of 2% Inflation Goal, Lagarde Tells Xinhua
content: The European Central Bank is approaching its goal for consumer-price growth, President Christine Lagarde said, warning of uncertainty emanating from US tariffs.

title: Switzerland’s Likely Rate Cut to Zero Threatens to Test Banks
content: The Swiss National Bank’s next cut in borrowing costs may be about to cause a headache for banks, if officials end up experimenting with their first-ever interest rate of zero.

title: Japan Seeks Possibility of Trade Deal With US as G-7 Looms
content: Japan and the US held another round of trade talks in Washington as officials try to reach an agreement ahead of a Group of Seven summit in Canada and a meeting between President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.

title: Belgium’s Credit Rating Cut by Fitch as Budget Concerns Linger
content: Belgium’s sovereign credit was cut by Fitch Ratings, signaling an increase in uncertainty about the country’s ability to rein in years of substantial debt accumulation.

title: Port of LA Imports Drop 19% in May as Tariffs Hit US Businesses
content: Import volumes through the busiest trade hub in the US fell 19% from the month before, a fallout from President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: Bets Emerge That End to Powell’s Term Means More Fed Rate Cuts
content: The prospect of a shift in US monetary policy when President Donald Trump replaces Jerome Powell at the end of his term as Federal Reserve chair in May 2026 has interest-rate traders looking for pay dirt.

title: Dutch Cabinet Approves NATO’s 5% Defense Spending Target
content: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof’s caretaker cabinet agreed to increase defense and security spending to 5% of gross domestic product by 2032 in line with the North Atlantic Treaty Organization’s proposed target.

title: Israel-Iran Conflict Risks More Inflation, Delayed Fed Rate Cuts
content: Israel’s attacks on Iran’s nuclear facilities risk pushing back the timeline for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts as the US central bank waits to assess any potential impact on inflation, economists said.

title: Starmer Signals Support for 3.5% NATO Aim With Talks on Date
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer indicated that the UK was prepared to endorse a new NATO target committing 3.5% of members’ economic output to core defense spending, although he emphasized that key details such as the timeline were still being negotiated.

title: Germany’s Klingbeil to Support Push to End EU Capital-Markets Impasse
content: German Finance Minister and Vice Chancellor Lars Klingbeil said he’ll support a push to try to break a deadlock on a decade-old European Union effort to deepen the bloc’s capital markets.

title: Indian Tax Authorities Chasing Unreported Crypto Transactions
content: Indian tax authorities are investigating tax evasion and money laundering by “high-risk persons” through cryptocurrency, a government official said Friday.

title: Oil Tanker Market Roiled by Israeli Airstrikes Against Iran
content: Israel’s overnight airstrikes on Iran drove up freight rates and tanker stocks Friday as traders and investors priced in the prospect of disruption to a large swath of the global oil-shipping fleet.

title: Keir Starmer Says UK Is Luring Top Talent Even as Non-Doms Leave
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he wants to attract more investors to Britain, even as the nation contends with an exodus of wealthy individuals because of tax hikes.

title: Starmer Says UK Has ‘Grave Concerns’ on Iran Nuclear Program
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the UK has “grave concerns” about Iran’s nuclear program and backed Israel’s right to self-defense, while calling for de-escalation in a conflict that risks engulfing the Middle East.

title: Starmer Says No Obstacles Left in Finishing US-UK Trade Deal
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said there are no “hiccups or obstacles” remaining in the way of finalizing a trade deal with the US and indicated that an agreement would likely come soon.

title: US Consumer Sentiment Jumps as Inflation Expectations Improve
content: US consumer sentiment rose by the most since January 2024 as concerns about the economy eased and short-term inflation expectations showed a marked improvement.

title: Netherlands Picks Sleijpen to Succeed Knot at Central Bank
content: The Dutch government appointed Olaf Sleijpen to head the central bank, sticking with an insider for the traditionally hawkish institution.

title: Trump Ripping Up the Free Trade Playbook Comes With $1 Trillion Cost
content: The ominous trajectory of the US president’s tariff overhaul looms over the G-7 gathering.

title: Japan’s Kato Says Talks With Markets Key for Bond Issuance
content: Japan’s Finance Minister said that discussions with market participants is a key factor in making sure that government bonds are bought and sold stably, as the ministry neared a closely watched gathering with investors.

title: US Corporate Profit Fat Offers Cushion for Absorbing Tariffs
content: I’m Ben Holland, an economics editor in Washington. Today we’re looking at the implications for inflation from US corporate profit margins. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Wrecking Ball Trump Makes the G-7 More Necessary
content: The upcoming conclave in Canada may be the rare space to find common ground, even as the forum itself is looking increasingly outmoded.

title: UK Household Inflation Expectations Fell Before April CPI Spike
content: UK households had been expecting inflation to slow over the coming year, according to a Bank of England survey that was conducted before the sudden jump in consumer prices reported last month.

title: PSP Hunts for More Canada Deals as Assets Surge to $220 Billion
content: Canada’s Public Sector Pension Investment Board is looking to deploy more capital in its home country after years of global expansion that has pushed its investment portfolio to C$300 billion ($220 billion).

title: No Clarity for Fed Until at Least September, Economists Say
content: It will take months yet before the Federal Reserve can get a clear idea of how Trump administration policy changes will shape the US economy, making officials unlikely to consider a change to interest rates before September, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg News.

title: Unrest Grips Bolivia as Dollar Crisis Sends Inflation Soaring
content: Lea en español

title: Huelgas y crisis del dólar llevan la inflación en Bolivia a un récord
content: Read the story in English

title: South Africa Rail Firm Averts Strike as Unions Accept Deal
content: South Africa’s state-owned ports and freight-rail company reached a pay deal with its two recognized labor unions, averting a strike that threatened to disrupt mineral and agricultural exports.

title: Boeing Sees Need For 44,000 New Jets; Cautions on Slow Output
content: Boeing Co. predicted airlines will need 43,600 new aircraft over the next 20 years, with markets like China and Southeast Asia leading the push as greater prosperity gives more people the means to travel.

title: India Ramps Up Inspections of Boeing 787s After Fatal Crash
content: India aviation regulators said urgent safety checks would be carried out for dozens of Boeing Co. 787 jets in the wake of the Air India crash that killed all but one of the 242 people on board.

title: Iran Conflict Ensnares Energy as Israel Hits Giant Gas Field
content: The unfolding Middle East crisis extended to Iran’s energy infrastructure as Israel launched an attack on a giant gas field in the Persian Gulf, threatening further turmoil for markets.

title: US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel Poised to Close After Trump Deal
content: Nippon Steel Corp. won conditional US approval for its $14.1 billion purchase of United States Steel Corp., capping a lengthy saga in a tie-up that will create one of the world’s largest steel companies.

title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa to Lead HIV Fund Replenishment
content: South Africa will lead the next refunding exercise for the Global Fund, raising money for the international partnership fighting AIDS after the US cut healthcare support to the continent.

title: UniCredit Owns 1.9% of Mediobanca Ahead of Bank Investor Meeting
content: UniCredit SpA holds a 1.9% equity stake in Mediobanca SpA, allowing it to participate in a key vote by the investment bank’s shareholders to endorse its plan to take over Banca Generali SpA.

title: Russia, China to Lead Construction of Two Kazakh Nuclear Plants
content: Kazakhstan has selected Russia’s Rosatom to lead a consortium for the construction of its first nuclear power plant. The China National Nuclear Corp. expected to be lead a group to build a second atomic facility.

title: Metro Bank Gets Takeover Approach From Pollen Street, Sky Says
content: Metro Bank Holdings Plc has been approached about a potential takeover offer led by private equity group Pollen Street Capital that could result in another delisting from the London Stock Exchange, Sky News reported Saturday.

title: Banking’s Mediterranean Deal Flurry Widens With Novo Banco Sale
content: The wave of bank acquisitions washing over Southern Europe has reached Portugal.

title: HSBC Hastens Search to Find Next Chairman as Tucker’s Exit Nears
content: With the clock ticking in the hunt for HSBC Holdings Plc’s next chairman, Europe’s largest bank is speeding its efforts to assemble a list of candidates for the role.

title: Grupo Mexico Will Sell Highway Business for $406 Million
content: Grupo Mexico, the copper mining conglomerate controlled by Mexican billionaire German Larrea, will sell its highway business for 7.7 billion pesos ($406 million) to local investment trusts FIBRAeMX and FEXI in the latest move to restructure the company.

title: Neuralink Device Helps Monkey See Something That’s Not There
content: Elon Musk’s Neuralink Corp. used a brain implant to enable a monkey to see something that wasn’t physically there, according to an engineer, as it moves toward its goal of helping blind people see.

title: FDA Tells Drugmaker ‘Heavy Workload’ to Delay Approval Decision
content: US regulators delayed their decision on whether to approve the first pill taken on demand for a rare, inherited swelling disorder due to a “heavy workload and limited resources,” a biotech company said.

title: Blackstone Said to Be in Talks to Buy Embattled Allegiant Resort
content: Blackstone Inc. is in talks to purchase Allegiant Travel Co.’s Sunseeker Resort, moving the parent of Allegiant Airlines closer to shedding the beleaguered retreat that had been a drag on earnings, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Key Iran Nuclear Enrichment Site of Natanz Shows No Sign of Breach
content: The United Nations atomic watchdog said Israeli strikes destroyed several facilities at Iran’s main uranium-enrichment site of Natanz but not the underground area where uranium enrichment takes place.

title: Lilly’s Experimental Obesity Drug Shows Promise in Early Study
content: An experimental weight-loss drug from Eli Lilly & Co. helped patients lose weight with few side effects, according to the summary of a small study that suggests the company has another foothold in the obesity market.

title: Trump Plans Biofuel Quota Boost, Seeks to Crimp Imports
content: The Trump administration is proposing oil refiners blend more biofuels into gasoline and diesel next year, while seeking to discourage the use of imported supplies.

title: Hedge Funds Ramped Up Bullish Oil Bets Ahead of Israel’s Attack
content: Hedge funds took the most bullish stance on US crude since January in the week before Israel launched strikes against Iran’s nuclear program, putting them in a position to profit from this week’s jump in oil prices.

title: Europe Set to Move a Step Closer to Halting Russian Gas Imports
content: The European Union is expected to take a major step next week toward curbing Russian gas imports starting next year with aims to sever ties with its former top supplier by the end of 2027.

title: British Virgin Islands, Bolivia Put on Watchdog ‘Gray List’
content: The British Virgin Islands and Bolivia were added to a global financial watchdog’s “gray list” for shortcomings in combating illicit flows, a move that may hamper investor confidence and heighten bank scrutiny.

title: Boeing Delivers First Jet to China in Tariff War Reprieve
content: Boeing Co. delivered its first aircraft to a Chinese airline customer since President Donald Trump unleashed a wave of tariffs in early April, a sign of rapprochement as Washington and Beijing look to ease tensions.

title: Swiss Industrials Company Sika Sees Big India Opportunity
content: Sika AG Chief Executive Officer Thomas Hasler views the Indian market as being one of the biggest opportunities for the Swiss building products company over the next few years.

title: Kohl’s CEO Tries to Reverse Record-Low Morale in Latest Address
content: Kohl’s Corp.’s interim Chief Executive Officer Michael Bender tried to quell employee unrest during one of his first all-hands calls since replacing Ashley Buchanan last month.

title: Airbus Says Air India Accident Is Learning Moment for Industry
content: Airbus SE said the fatal accident on Thursday in India involving a Boeing Co. airliner should spur the industry as a whole to advance its safety culture, dismissing the notion that the crash could bring a competitive edge to one planemaker over the other in the global duopoly.

title: Key Oil Market Trades Are Lighting Up After Israel’s Attack
content: Israel’s extensive strikes against Iran’s nuclear facilities, a dramatic new turn in the conflict in the Middle East, are rippling across the energy market.

title: Chevron to Name Van Dyke Commodities Lead in Trading Revamp
content: Chevron Corp. is promoting some of its traders and offered voluntary severance to others as part of a restructuring of its trading division aimed at cutting costs and boosting performance.

title: Centerview Is Sole Bank on Meta’s $14 Billion AI Bet
content: One of the largest-ever investments in a private US company has minted just one investment banking winner: Centerview Partners.

title: Delta, United Suspend Flights to Tel Aviv After Iran Bombing
content: Delta Air Lines Inc. and United Airlines Holdings Inc. suspended flights to Tel Aviv following Israel’s bombing of Iran and the closure of Israel’s airspace.

title: FIFA to Splash $1 Billion of Prize Money on First Club World Cup
content: FIFA, the global governing body of international soccer, has lured some of the world’s top teams to the US for an inaugural Club World Cup with a record $1 billion to be distributed over the next month.

title: US to Ease Rules Hindering Tesla’s Self-Driving Cybercab
content: The Trump administration is taking steps that would make it easier for automakers to deploy-self driving cars without driver controls, a potential boon to the ambitions of Tesla Inc. and rivals looking to put robotaxis on US roads in the near future.
